item.description: Pat Cummins takes his second wicket of the innings as Joe Root is caught behind for 19 as England fall to 71-4 in their first innings, 300 runs behind Australia's 371, as the home side take control on day two of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Joshua doubles down on vulgar 'kill' comments to Paul
item.description: Anthony Joshua doubles down on his controversial "kill" comments to Jake Paul after being challenged at a news conference in Miami.

item.description: Canada's population declined by more than 76,000 people between July and October, driven by a drop in foreign students and temporary workers.

item.title: Indian scientists predict how bird flu could spread to humans
item.description: Scientists have warned H5N1 bird flu could make a dangerous leap to humans, triggering a global health crisis.

item.description: The ex-podcaster announced he would leave the FBI after US President Donald Trump told reporters he "wants to go back to his show".

item.description: Footage shows a man believed to be the 32-year-old wandering in a shop before his arrest in the deaths of his parents, Rob and Michele.

item.title: Archer finishes with five wickets as Australia bowled out for 371
item.description: Jofra Archer removes Mitchell Starc and Nathan Lyon on the morning of day two to finish with figures of 5-53, earning his fourth career Test five-wicket haul as England bowl Australia out for 371 in their first innings of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: 'Can be as good as anyone' - Miley steps up for Newcastle

item.description: The England and Wales Cricket Board will meet with the game's governing body in an attempt to review and raise standards of the decision review system.

item.description: Anthony Joshua doubles down on his controversial "kill" comments to Jake Paul after being challenged at a news conference in Miami on Wednesday before their upcoming fight.
